      Subinterfaces of RequiredI in fr.upmc.alasca.requestgen.interfaces 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  RequestArrivalI
      The interface RequestArrivalI defines the protocol to send a request between an sender and a receiver Description The interface can be both required and offered, and it has only one method acceptRequest passing a request object as parameter.

    • Uses of RequiredI in fr.upmc.components.connectors

      Subinterfaces of RequiredI in fr.upmc.components.connectors 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  ConnectorI
      The interface ConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components.
      interface  DataConnectorI
      The interface BasicDataConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components that exchange data rather than calling services from each others.
      interface  DataTwoWayConnectorI
      The interface DataTwoWayConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between requiring and offering components that exchange data rather than calling services from each others, but using the same interface on both sides and act as peers in the exchange.
      interface  TwoWayConnectorI
      The interface TwoWayConnectorI is the generic interface for connectors that mediate between components exposing two-way interfaces.
      Classes in fr.upmc.components.connectors that implement RequiredI 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractConnector
      The class AbstractConnector partially implements an abstract connector between two components by assuming that the offering component implements the offered interface.
      class  AbstractDataConnector
      The class AbstractDataConnector partially implements a basic data connector between components exchanging data rather than calling each others services.
      class  AbstractDataTwoWayConnector
      The class AbstractDataTwoWayConnector partially implements a basic data connector between components exchanging data in a peer to peer way rather than calling each others services.
      class  AbstractTwoWayConnector
      The class AbstractTwoWayConnector partially implements a basic connector between components calling each others services in a peer to peer way rather than in a client-provider relationship.
      class  ActiveDataConnector
      The class ActiveBasicDataConnector partially implements an active connector that can be used to connect qctive components in a synchronised way, on a mix of active and passive components using a full or partial pull mode.
      class  DataConnector
      The class DataConnector partially implements a basic data connector where components call each others using plain Java method calls only.
      class  DataTwoWayConnector
      The class DataTwoWayConnector implements a standard connector for components exchanging data in a peer-to-peer mode using standard data two-way interfaces.

    • Uses of RequiredI in fr.upmc.components.interfaces

      Subinterfaces of RequiredI in fr.upmc.components.interfaces 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  DataOfferedI.PushI
      The interface DataOfferedI.PushI contains the signatures of the methods that are called by the offering component to send data to the requiring component.
      interface  DataRequiredI
      The interface DataRequiredI defines a basic interface for components that exchange raw data rather than calling each others services.
      static interface  DataRequiredI.PullI
      The interface DataRequiredI.PullI contains the signatures of the methods that can be called by the requiring components to get data from the offering component.
      interface  DataTwoWayI
      The interface TwoWayDataI enables two components to exchange data in a peer-to-peer way, that is the two components implement the same interface and have both the sender and receiver roles.
      static interface  DataTwoWayI.PullI
      The interface TwoWayDataI.PullI contains the signature of the method that is called by one component to get data from the other component.
      static interface  DataTwoWayI.PushI
      The interface TwoWayDataI.PushI contains the signature of the method that is called by one component to send data to the other component.
      interface  TwoWayI
      The interface TwoWayI is meant to represent symmetric interfaces connecting two components that can play both the role of clients and server towards each others.

    • Uses of RequiredI in fr.upmc.components.patterns.dconnection

      Subinterfaces of RequiredI in fr.upmc.components.patterns.dconnection 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DynamicConnectionRequestI
      The interface DynamicConnectionOfferedI is offered by components that propose a dynamic connection through some other dynamically connected interface.
      Classes in fr.upmc.components.patterns.dconnection that implement RequiredI 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  DynamicConnectionRequestConnector
      The class DynamicConnectionConnector Description Invariant invariant true Created on : 2013-01-23
      class  DynamicConnectionRequestInboundPort
      The class DynamicConnectionInboundPort implements the server side port used to request and establish dynamic connections among components.
      class  DynamicConnectionRequestOutboundPort
      The class DynamicConnectionOutboundPort implements the client side port used to request and establish dynamic connections among components.

    • Uses of RequiredI in fr.upmc.components.ports

      Subinterfaces of RequiredI in fr.upmc.components.ports 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      interface  DataInboundPortI
      The interface DataInboundPortI represents the category of ports used by components exchanging data rather than being called for their services.
      interface  DataOutboundPortI
      The interface DataOutboundPortI represents the category of ports used by components exchanging data rather than calling providers for their services.
      interface  DataTwoWayPortI
      The interface DataTwoWayPortI represents the category of PortI that cater for exchanging data among components that act both as clients and service providers towards each others on the same interface.
      interface  OutboundPortI
      The interface OutBoundPortI represents the category of PortI that cater for outgoing calls from a component towards its service providers.
      interface  TwoWayPortI
      The interface TwoWayPortI represents the category of PortI that cater for incoming and outgoing calls among components that act both as clients and service providers towards each others on the same interface.
      Classes in fr.upmc.components.ports that implement RequiredI 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractDataInboundPort
      The class AbstractDataInboundPort partially implements an inbound port for data exchanging components.
      class  AbstractDataOutboundPort
      The class AbstractDataOutboundPort partially implements an outbound port for data exchanging components.
      class  AbstractDataTwoWayPort
      The class AbstractDataTwoWayPort partially implements a data two-way port for components exchanging data with each others in a peer-to-peer fashion.
      class  AbstractOutboundPort
      The class AbstractOutboundPort partially implements an outbound port which implements the required interface of the owning component so that it can call its providers through this port.
      class  AbstractTwoWayPort
      The class AbstractTwoWayPort partially implements a two-way port for components calling each others in a peer-to-peer fashion.
